name: Kimsuky
descr:
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) is a North Korea-based cyber espionage group that has been active since at least 2012. The group initially focused on targeting South Korean government entities, think tanks, and individuals identified as experts in various fields, and expanded its operations to include the UN and the government, education, business services, and manufacturing sectors in the United States, Japan, Russia, and Europe. [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has focused its intelligence collection activities on foreign policy and national security issues related to the Korean peninsula, nuclear policy, and sanctions. [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) operations have overlapped with those of other North Korean cyber espionage actors likely as a result of ad hoc collaborations or other limited resource sharing.(Citation: EST Kimsuky April 2019)(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)(Citation: Proofpoint TA427 April 2024)

[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) was assessed to be responsible for the 2014 Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power Co. compromise; other notable campaigns include Operation STOLEN PENCIL (2018), Operation Kabar Cobra (2019), and Operation Smoke Screen (2019).(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)(Citation: EST Kimsuky SmokeScreen April 2019)(Citation: AhnLab Kimsuky Kabar Cobra Feb 2019)

North Korean group definitions are known to have significant overlap, and some security researchers report all North Korean state-sponsored cyber activity under the name [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032) instead of tracking clusters or subgroups.

In 2023, [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used commercial large language models to assist with vulnerability research, scripting, social engineering and reconnaissance.(Citation: MSFT-AI)

subtechniques.name: Additional Local or Domain Groups
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has added accounts to specific groups with net localgroup.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Acquire Infrastructure
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used funds from stolen and laundered cryptocurrency to acquire operational infrastructure.(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Domains
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has registered domains to spoof targeted organizations and trusted third parties including search engines, web platforms, and cryptocurrency exchanges.(Citation: ThreatConnect Kimsuky September 2020)(Citation: Zdnet Kimsuky Group September 2020)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 Full PDF Report)

subtechniques.name: Server
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has purchased hosting servers with virtual currency and prepaid cards.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Web Services
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has hosted content used for targeting efforts via web services such as Blogspot.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Adversary-in-the-Middle
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used modified versions of PHProxy to examine web traffic between the victim and the accessed website.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094)  has used HTTP GET and POST requests for C2.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: File Transfer Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used FTP to download additional malware to the target machine.(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)

subtechniques.name: Mail Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used e-mail to send exfiltrated data to C2 servers.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used QuickZip to archive stolen files before exfiltration.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Custom Method
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used RC4 encryption before exfil.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has placed scripts in the startup folder for persistence and modified the `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce` Registry key.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Crowdstrike GTR2020 Mar 2020)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Browser Session Hijacking
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has the ability to use form-grabbing to extract emails and passwords from web data forms.(Citation: Zscaler Kimsuky TRANSLATEXT)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has executed a variety of PowerShell scripts including Invoke-Mimikatz.(Citation: EST Kimsuky April 2019)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has executed Windows commands by using `cmd` and running batch scripts.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used Visual Basic to download malicious payloads.(Citation: ThreatConnect Kimsuky September 2020)(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)(Citation: Crowdstrike GTR2020 Mar 2020)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021) [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has also used malicious VBA macros within maldocs disguised as forms that trigger when a victim types any content into the lure.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Python
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a macOS Python implant to gather data as well as MailFetcher.py code to automatically collect email data.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: JavaScript
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used JScript for logging and downloading additional tools.(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky) [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used [TRANSLATEXT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1201), which contained four Javascript files for bypassing defenses, collecting sensitive information and screenshots, and exfiltrating data.(Citation: Zscaler Kimsuky TRANSLATEXT)

subtechniques.name: Email Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has compromised email accounts to send spearphishing e-mails.(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)

subtechniques.name: Domains
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has compromised legitimate sites and used them to distribute malware.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 Full PDF Report)

subtechniques.name: Local Account
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has created accounts with net user.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Windows Service
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has created new services for persistence.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

subtechniques.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used browser extensions including Google Chrome to steal passwords and cookies from browsers. [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has also used Nirsoft's WebBrowserPassView tool to dump the passwords obtained from victims.(Citation: Zdnet Kimsuky Dec 2018)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Data from Local System
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has collected Office, PDF, and HWP documents from its victims.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Local Data Staging
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has staged collected data files under C:\Program Files\Common Files\System\Ole DB\.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has decoded malicious VBScripts using Base64.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Develop Capabilities

subtechniques.name: Malware
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has developed its own unique malware such as MailFetch.py for use in operations.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)

technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) created and used a mailing toolkit to use in spearphishing attacks.(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)

subtechniques.name: Remote Email Collection
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used tools such as the MailFetch mail crawler to collect victim emails (excluding spam) from online services via IMAP.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Email Forwarding Rule
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has set auto-forward rules on victim's e-mail accounts.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

technique_table_data.name: Establish Accounts

subtechniques.name: Social Media Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has created social media accounts to monitor news and security trends as well as potential targets.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Email Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has created email accounts for phishing operations.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)(Citation: Proofpoint TA427 April 2024)

technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has leveraged stolen PII to create accounts.(Citation: Mandiant APT43 Full PDF Report)

subtechniques.name: Change Default File Association
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has a HWP document stealer module which changes the default program association in the registry to open HWP documents.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)

technique_table_data.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has exfiltrated data over its C2 channel.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Exfiltration to Cloud Storage
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has exfiltrated stolen files and data to actor-controlled Blogspot accounts.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has exploited various vulnerabilities for initial access, including Microsoft Exchange vulnerability CVE-2020-0688.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: External Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used RDP to establish persistence.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

technique_table_data.name: File and Directory Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has the ability to enumerate all files and directories on an infected system.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Financial Theft
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has stolen and laundered cryptocurrency to self-fund operations including the acquisition of infrastructure.(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 Full PDF Report)

subtechniques.name: Email Addresses
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has collected valid email addresses including personal accounts that were subsequently used for spearphishing and other forms of social engineering.(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint TA427 April 2024)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 Full PDF Report)

subtechniques.name: Employee Names
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has collected victim employee name information.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Gather Victim Org Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has collected victim organization information including but not limited to organization hierarchy, functions, press releases, and others.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi) [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has also used large language models (LLMs) to gather information about potential targets of interest.(Citation: MSFT-AI)

subtechniques.name: Hidden Users
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has run reg add ‘HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList’ /v to hide a newly created user.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Hidden Window
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used an information gathering module that will hide an AV software window from the victim.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has been observed turning off Windows Security Center and can hide the AV software window from the view of the infected user.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify System Firewall
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has been observed disabling the system firewall.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)

technique_table_data.name: Impersonation
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has impersonated academic institutions and NGOs in order to gain information related to North Korea.(Citation: MSFT-AI)

subtechniques.name: File Deletion
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has deleted the exfiltrated data on disk after transmission. [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has also used an instrumentor script to terminate browser processes running on an infected system and then delete the cookie files on disk.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Timestomp
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has manipulated timestamps for creation or compilation dates to defeat anti-forensics.(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has downloaded additional scripts, tools, and malware onto victim systems.(Citation: Crowdstrike GTR2020 Mar 2020)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Keylogging
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a PowerShell-based keylogger as well as a tool called MECHANICAL to log keystrokes.(Citation: EST Kimsuky April 2019)(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Internal Spearphishing
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has sent internal spearphishing emails for lateral movement after stealing victim information.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Task or Service
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has disguised services to appear as benign software or related to operating system functions.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has renamed malware to legitimate names such as ESTCommon.dll or patch.dll.(Citation: Kimsuky Malwarebytes)

technique_table_data.name: Modify Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has modified Registry settings for default file associations to enable all macros and for persistence.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Crowdstrike GTR2020 Mar 2020)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Multi-Factor Authentication Interception
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a proprietary tool to intercept one time passwords required for two-factor authentication.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Network Sniffing
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used the Nirsoft SniffPass network sniffer to obtain passwords sent over non-secure protocols.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)

technique_table_data.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has obfuscated binary strings including the use of XOR encryption and Base64 encoding.(Citation: ThreatConnect Kimsuky September 2020)(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019) [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has also modified the first byte of DLL implants targeting victims to prevent recognition of the executable file format.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Software Packing
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has packed malware with UPX.(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has obtained and used tools such as Nirsoft WebBrowserPassVIew, [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002), and [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029).(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing Certificates
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has stolen a valid certificate that is used to sign the malware and the dropper.(Citation: S2W Troll Stealer 2024)

subtechniques.name: Exploits
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has obtained exploit code for various CVEs.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has gathered credentials using [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) and ProcDump.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Phishing
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used spearphishing to gain initial access and intelligence.(Citation: MSFT-AI)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 Full PDF Report)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used emails containing Word, Excel and/or HWP (Hangul Word Processor) documents in their spearphishing campaigns.(Citation: Zdnet Kimsuky Dec 2018)(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: ThreatConnect Kimsuky September 2020)(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has sent spearphishing emails containing a link to a document that contained malicious macros or took the victim to an actor-controlled domain.(Citation: EST Kimsuky April 2019)(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Phishing for Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used tailored spearphishing emails to gather victim information including contat lists to identify additional targets.(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used links in e-mail to steal account information including web beacons for target profiling.(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)(Citation: Proofpoint TA427 April 2024)

technique_table_data.name: Process Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) can gather a list of all processes running on a victim's machine.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Process Injection
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used Win7Elevate to inject malicious code into explorer.exe.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)

subtechniques.name: Process Hollowing
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a file injector DLL to spawn a benign process on the victim's system and inject the malicious payload into it via process hollowing.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Query Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has obtained specific Registry keys and values on a compromised host.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Reflective Code Loading
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used the Invoke-Mimikatz PowerShell script to reflectively load a Mimikatz credential stealing DLL into memory.(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Software
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a modified TeamViewer client as a command and control channel.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: Crowdstrike GTR2020 Mar 2020)

subtechniques.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used RDP for direct remote point-and-click access.(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has downloaded additional malware with scheduled tasks.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.name: Screen Capture
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has captured browser screenshots using [TRANSLATEXT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1201).(Citation: Zscaler Kimsuky TRANSLATEXT)

technique_table_data.name: Search Open Technical Databases
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used LLMs to better understand publicly reported vulnerabilities.(Citation: MSFT-AI)(Citation: OpenAI-CTI)

technique_table_data.name: Search Open Websites/Domains

subtechniques.name: Social Media
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used Twitter to monitor potential victims and to prepare targeted phishing e-mails.(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)

subtechniques.name: Search Engines
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has searched for vulnerabilities, tools, and geopolitical trends on Google to target victims.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used LLMs to identify think tanks, government organizations, etc. that have information.(Citation: MSFT-AI)

technique_table_data.name: Search Victim-Owned Websites
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has searched for information on the target company's website.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Web Shell
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used modified versions of open source PHP web shells to maintain access, often adding "Dinosaur" references within the code.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

subtechniques.name: Security Software Discovery
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has checked for the presence of antivirus software with powershell Get-CimInstance -Namespace root/securityCenter2 – classname antivirusproduct.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Browser Extensions
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used Google Chrome browser extensions to infect victims and to steal passwords and cookies.(Citation: Zdnet Kimsuky Dec 2018)(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Upload Malware
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used compromised and acquired infrastructure to host and deliver malware including Blogspot to host beacons, file exfiltrators, and implants.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 March 2024)(Citation: Mandiant APT43 Full PDF Report)

technique_table_data.name: Steal Web Session Cookie
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used malware, such as [TRANSLATEXT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1201), to steal and exfiltrate browser cookies.(Citation: Zscaler Kimsuky TRANSLATEXT)(Citation: S2W Troll Stealer 2024)

subtechniques.name: Code Signing
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has signed files with the name EGIS CO,. Ltd. and has stolen a valid certificate that is used to sign the malware and the dropper.(Citation: ThreatConnect Kimsuky September 2020)(Citation: S2W Troll Stealer 2024)

subtechniques.name: Mshta
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used mshta.exe to run malicious scripts on the system.(Citation: EST Kimsuky April 2019)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Crowdstrike GTR2020 Mar 2020)(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Regsvr32
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has executed malware with regsvr32s.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Rundll32
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used `rundll32.exe` to execute malicious scripts and malware on a victim's network.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has enumerated drives, OS type, OS version, and other information using a script or the "systeminfo" command.(Citation: Securelist Kimsuky Sept 2013)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used `ipconfig/all` and web beacons sent via email to gather network configuration information.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint TA427 April 2024)

technique_table_data.name: System Service Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used an instrumentor script to gather the names of all services running on a victim's system.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

technique_table_data.name: Traffic Signaling
technique_table_data.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used [TRANSLATEXT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1201) to redirect clients to legitimate Gmail, Naver or Kakao pages if the clients connect with no parameters.(Citation: Zscaler Kimsuky TRANSLATEXT)

subtechniques.name: Credentials In Files
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used tools that are capable of obtaining credentials from saved mail.(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Pass the Hash
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used pass the hash for authentication to remote access software used in C2.(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has lured victims into clicking malicious links.(Citation: KISA Operation Muzabi)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used attempted to lure victims into opening malicious e-mail attachments.(Citation: ThreatConnect Kimsuky September 2020)(Citation: VirusBulletin Kimsuky October 2019)(Citation: CISA AA20-301A Kimsuky)(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Kimsuky June 2021)(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)

subtechniques.name: Local Accounts
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a tool called GREASE to add a Windows admin account in order to allow them continued access via RDP.(Citation: Netscout Stolen Pencil Dec 2018)

subtechniques.name: Dead Drop Resolver
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used [TRANSLATEXT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1201) and a dead drop resolver to retrieve configurations and commands from a public blog site.(Citation: Zscaler Kimsuky TRANSLATEXT)

subtechniques.name: Bidirectional Communication
subtechniques.descr: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used Blogspot pages and a Github repository for C2.(Citation: Talos Kimsuky Nov 2021)(Citation: Zscaler Kimsuky TRANSLATEXT)
